programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Houston (4-5) ended a two-game skid with a 24-21 win over DC behind 255 total yards from Jalan McClendon; Michigan (6-3) is 3-1 at home, and defeated the Roughnecks, 30-18, on May 17 behind three passing touchdowns from Danny Etling.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's College World Series
programme.desc: NiJaree Canady allowed just two hits and recorded 10 strikeouts over 7.0 scoreless innings to help send No. 12 Texas Tech past Ole Miss, 1-0, in Game 3; No. 9 UCLA defeated No. 16 Oregon, 4-2, in Game 4, as Jessica Clements hit a two-run walk-off HR.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Fernando Valenzuela set off a craze around the country, primarily in the Los Angeles area, after he was acquired by the Dodgers, and the 1981 season saw his relationship with the Latino community blossom and the establishment of "Fernandomania."

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Chad Patrick (2-4, 2.97) shut out Boston in 4.2 innings, striking out six, on May 26; Jesus Luzardo (5-0, 2.15) allowed three runs or fewer in each of his 11 starts this season after holding the Athletics to three runs in seven innings on May 25.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim secured his fourth win of the season and second in the last four races with a dominant victory at Charlotte over Ross Chastain; Christian Eckes averaged 101.829 mph in his win at Nashville last year, beating Daniel Dye by 2.028 seconds.

programme.desc: NXT drivers aim for the best starting position in the upcoming race in Detroit, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded the pole position on the front row of the starting grid; the second-fastest time starts outside the pole sitter.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Warmup
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers head out on the track to get ready for the upcoming race with some warmup laps, as analysts preview the Detroit Grand Prix and two-time defending champion Alex Palou, who comes off his first Indianapolis 500 win of his career.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Warmup
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers head out on the track to get ready for the upcoming race with some warmup laps, as analysts preview the Detroit Grand Prix and two-time defending champion Alex Palou, who comes off his first Indianapolis 500 win of his career.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Lochie Hughes cut his deficit to fellow rookie Dennis Hauger to 15 points after finishing first and second in the two races at Indianapolis; Louis Foster won the race at Detroit last year over Caio Collet en route to the 2024 championship.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Bailey Ober (4-1, 3.41) is 3-0 with a 2.08 ERA in his last seven starts after holding Kansas City to one run in 6.2 innings on May 25; Bryce Miller (2-4, 5.22) comes off the 15-day IL after allowing seven runs vs. Toronto on May 11.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Michael Soroka (1-3, 5.61) gave up three runs or fewer in his last three starts after holding San Francisco to three runs; Brandon Pfaadt (7-3, 3.90) comes off his first no-decision this season, holding St. Louis to three runs in 5.2 innings.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship
programme.desc: USA claimed 7-0 victories against Puerto Rico in both of their meetings from 2022's Championship, last led by a hat-trick from Simone Jackson in the semi-finals round; Michelle Copper found the net with a brace in the shutout win.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Will Warren (3-2, 4.09) is 2-0 with a 2.05 ERA in his last four starts after holding Colorado to two runs in four innings; Landon Knack (2-2, 5.22) held the Mets to three runs, one earned, on four hits in six innings in a loss on May 25.

programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou continued his dominant start with his first Indianapolis 500 win of his career to increase his lead over Pato O'Ward to 112 points; Scott Dixon won the race at Detroit last year over Marcus Ericsson.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Vancouver progressed past Inter Miami with a 5-1 aggregate victory in the semi-finals round after a 3-1 win in the second leg on April 30; Cruz Azul claimed a 2-1 aggregate win against Tigres through a 1-0 shutout victory in the second leg on May 1.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (6-3) won three of its last four games after a 26-22 win over Michigan behind J'Mar Simth and Larry Rountree III; Memphis (2-7) defeated the Stallions, 24-20, on April 25 behind 235 passing yards from Dresser Winn.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Coverage of professional baseball.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Tony Stewart leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by three points, Austin Prock leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by 51 points and Dallas Glenn leads Greg Anderson in Pro Stock by 11 points following Chicago, the sixth event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim secured his fourth win of the season and second in the last four races with a dominant victory at Charlotte over Ross Chastain; Christian Eckes averaged 101.829 mph in his win at Nashville last year, beating Daniel Dye by 2.028 seconds.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Adelaide (7-4-0) has won three of its last four contests after defeating West Coast, 128-62, on May 24; Sydney (4-7-0) has won the past six meetings, including a 121-90 triumph last season in Round 24, as Luke Parker had 19 disposals and three goals.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: Atlético Ottawa claimed a 4-1 victory against Vancouver in their first meeting of the season on April 13, led by a goal and an assist from David Rodriguez; Kévin Santos, Ballou Tabla and Monty Mark Patterson rounded out the scoring in the win.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: The Rover of Tobruk
programme.desc: The life of Bob Quinn was much more than becoming a legend and captain for the Port Adelaide Football Club, serving his country of Australia during World War II and receiving the Military Medal for his actions during the Siege of Tobruk.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: HFX Wanderers claimed a 2-1 victory against York United in their first meeting of the season on April 13 after being down, 1-0, at half-time; Giorgio Probo and Tiago Coimbra found the net for HFX in the second half of the comeback win at home.

programme.title: NRL Hits Vegas
programme.desc: The NRL stepped outside of Australia to open its 2024 season under the bright, neon lights of Las Vegas, as the documentary shows all-access footage and interviews with the people that made it happen and the players who got a unique experience.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Tigres and Cruz Azul played to a 1-1 draw in the first leg of the semi-final on April 23 where Juan José Purata equalized for Tigres in the 85th minute of play; Carlos Rotondi had broken the 0-0 deadlock in the 69th minute of the draw.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: New Zealand (8-0-3) snapped an eight-match losing streak to the Rabbitohs with a 34-4 victory last season, as Shaun Johnson notched two tries and added five conversions; South Sydney (6-0-5), which comes off a bye in Round 12, has won two in a row.

programme.title: 2025 U.S. Women's Open Golf Championship
programme.desc: The event, which debuted in 1946 and features the largest purse in women's professional golf at $12 million, is the longest-running tournament currently on the LPGA Tour; Yuka Saso of Japan defeated Hinako Shibuno by three strokes in 2024.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf
programme.desc: American John Catlin finished at 14-under 274 before defeating Maximilian Kieffer of Germany on the fifth play-off hole to win the tournament the last time it was played in 2021; Golfclub Gut Altentann last hosted the tournament in the 1992 edition.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler took home a $4 million payday after carding a 2-over 74 over the final round to remain atop the leaderboard at 8-under 280 to hold off Collin Morikawa for a one-shot victory in last year's edition of the tournament.

programme.title: 5 Clubs with Gary Williams
programme.desc: Gary Williams, the original host of Morning Drive on the Golf Channel, hosts the podcast that features interviews with golf's top personalities, provides golf equipment reviews in the Tool Box segment, golf travel destination tips and much more.

programme.title: 2025 U.S. Women's Open Golf Championship
programme.desc: Yuka Saso of Japan carded a 2-under 68 over the final round to finish atop the leaderboard at 4-under 276 and captured the title for the second time in four years with a three-stroke victory over Hinako Shibuno in last year's edition.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Some of the best teenage golfers in the country spend time at the Hank Haney Golf Academy in order to take their game to the next level; the teenagers will get professional instruction while trying to manage their high school lives.

programme.desc: All of the latest news, highlights and inside information from the Champions Tour is provided along with helpful instruction from the legendary players on the tour, who are some of the most experienced professionals in the game.
